    • Method Detail

      • setCircularImageWithPicasso

        public static <T extends android.widget.ImageView> void setCircularImageWithPicasso(java.lang.String urlThumbnail,
                                                                                    T viewToSet,
                                                                                    int backupImageResourceId,
                                                                                    android.content.Context context,
                                                                                    java.lang.Float percentMaxCache,
                                                                                    java.lang.Integer circularFrameColor,
                                                                                    java.lang.Integer circularFrameWidth)
        Set a circular image into a view and set caching.
        Type Parameters:
        T - {T extends View}
        Parameters:
        urlThumbnail - URL String to use
        viewToSet - View to set it into
        backupImageResourceId - Backup resource id in case the String url fails parsing
        context - Context
        percentMaxCache - Percent max cache to use (float, <1 && >0, IE, 0.45 == 45% of max cache. Note that Picasso defaults to 14.3% of max cache if null sent
        context - circularFrameColor Circular frame color (surrounds outside of image)
        context - circularFrameWidth Circular frame width (in pixels)

      • setCircularImageWithPicasso

        public static <T extends android.widget.ImageView> void setCircularImageWithPicasso(java.lang.String urlThumbnail,

                                                                                    android.content.Context context)

                                                  int degree)

        Parameters:
        bitmap - Bitmap to rotateImage
        degree - Degree amount to rotateImage. If <0 or >360, will set to 90 degrees. (Range is 0-360)

      • isImageTooLarge

        public static boolean isImageTooLarge(@NonNull
                                      android.graphics.Bitmap bmp,
                                      long desiredSizeInBytes)
        Determine if a bitmap is too large as compared to passed param
        Parameters:
        bmp - Bitmap to check
        desiredSizeInBytes - Desired size (in Bytes) to check against
        Returns:
        boolean, if true, bitmap is larger than the desired size, else, it is not.

      • getImageResizeFactor

        public static float getImageResizeFactor(@NonNull
                                         android.graphics.Bitmap bmp,
                                         long desiredSizeInBytes)
        Determine the float value needed to resize the image so that it is less in size (Bytes) than the value passed
        Parameters:
        bmp - Bitmap to check
        desiredSizeInBytes - Desired size in bytes of the image
        Returns:
        float value to resize. IE, if 0.34 is returned, the bitmap in question needs to be shrunk down by 34% to reach the desired size

      • resizePhoto

        public static android.graphics.Bitmap resizePhoto(@NonNull
                                                  android.graphics.Bitmap bmp,
                                                  int factorToDivide)
        Resize a photo
        Parameters:
        bmp - Bitmap to resize
        factorToDivide - Factor to divide by. if (IE) 2 is passed, it will cut the image in half, 10 will cut it down 10x in size. Note that scaling too much will result in geometric size jumps.
        Returns:
        Resized bitmap. If it fails, will send back original

      • resizePhoto

        public static android.graphics.Bitmap resizePhoto(@NonNull
                                                  android.graphics.Bitmap bmp,
                                                  long desiredImageSizeInBytes)
        Resize a photo
        Parameters:
        bmp - Bitmap to resize
        desiredImageSizeInBytes - The desired image size in bytes. IE, sending 5000000 (5 Million) would be a 5 Megapixel (MP) image.
        Returns:
        Resized bitmap. If it fails, will send back original

      • zoomAView

        public static void zoomAView()

      • getMaxCacheSize

        public static long getMaxCacheSize()
        Get the maximum system cache size for the app. Designed after this answer: https://stackoverflow.com/a/15763477/2480714 Note! DO NOT USE THE ENTIRE 100%! Use a fraction of it. (IE, 1/8th)
        Returns:
        long maximum cache size. (If an error occurs, return 0)

      • getLTRBSidesOfImage

        public static int[] getLTRBSidesOfImage(int topLeftX,
                                        int topLeftY,
                                        int bottomLeftX,
                                        int bottomLeftY,
                                        int topRightX,
                                        int topRightY,
                                        int bottomRightX,
                                        int bottomRightY)
        Get the Left, Top, Right, and Bottom sides of an image.
        Parameters:
        topLeftX - topLeft X position (from x,y coordinates)
        topLeftY - topLeft Y position (from x,y coordinates)
        bottomLeftX - bottomLeft X position (from x,y coordinates)
        bottomLeftY - bottomRight Y position (from x,y coordinates)
        topRightX - topRight X position (from x,y coordinates)
        topRightY - topRight Y position (from x,y coordinates)
        bottomRightX - bottomRight X position (from x,y coordinates)
        bottomRightY - bottomRight Y position (from x,y coordinates)
        Returns:

      • cropImage

        public static android.graphics.Bitmap cropImage(@NonNull
                                                android.graphics.Bitmap imageToBeCropped,
                                                int topLeftX,
                                                int topLeftY,
                                                int bottomLeftX,
                                                int bottomLeftY,
                                                int topRightX,
                                                int topRightY,
                                                int bottomRightX,
                                                int bottomRightY)
        Crop an image to the positions passed. If any # <0 is passed or an error occurs, it will return the original bitmap passed
        Parameters:
        imageToBeCropped - Image to be cropped
        topLeftX - topLeft X position (from x,y coordinates)
        topLeftY - topLeft Y position (from x,y coordinates)
        bottomLeftX - bottomLeft X position (from x,y coordinates)
        bottomLeftY - bottomRight Y position (from x,y coordinates)
        topRightX - topRight X position (from x,y coordinates)
        topRightY - topRight Y position (from x,y coordinates)
        bottomRightX - bottomRight X position (from x,y coordinates)
        bottomRightY - bottomRight Y position (from x,y coordinates)
        Returns:
        Cropped image. Will return same passed bitmap if operation fails

      • cropImage

        public static android.graphics.Bitmap cropImage(@NonNull
                                                android.graphics.Bitmap imageToBeCropped,
                                                int topLeftX,
                                                int topLeftY,
                                                int bottomLeftX,
                                                int bottomLeftY,
                                                int topRightX,
                                                int topRightY,
                                                int bottomRightX,
                                                int bottomRightY,
                                                @Nullable
                                                java.lang.Float sidesBufferPercent)
        Crop an image to the positions passed. If any # <0 is passed or an error occurs, it will return the original bitmap passed
        Parameters:
        imageToBeCropped - Image to be cropped
        topLeftX - topLeft X position (from x,y coordinates)
        topLeftY - topLeft Y position (from x,y coordinates)
        bottomLeftX - bottomLeft X position (from x,y coordinates)
        bottomLeftY - bottomRight Y position (from x,y coordinates)
        topRightX - topRight X position (from x,y coordinates)
        topRightY - topRight Y position (from x,y coordinates)
        bottomRightX - bottomRight X position (from x,y coordinates)
        bottomRightY - bottomRight Y position (from x,y coordinates)
        sidesBufferPercent - Float percentage to allow buffer on sides for cropping. IE, sending in 0.10 would add a 10% buffer on each side to 'zoom out' on the cropped image. Useful if you want some extra side room
        Returns:
        Cropped image. Will return same passed bitmap if operation fails

      • cropImage

        public static android.graphics.Bitmap cropImage(@NonNull
                                                android.graphics.Bitmap imageToBeCropped,
                                                int startingXPos,
                                                int startingYPos,
                                                int endingXPos,
                                                int endingYPos)
        Crop an image to the positions passed. If any # <0 is passed or an error occurs, it will return the original bitmap passed
        Parameters:
        imageToBeCropped - Image to be cropped
        startingXPos - Starting X position (left side of the image)
        startingYPos - Starting Y position (Top side of the image)
        endingXPos - Ending X position (Right side of the image)
        endingYPos - Ending Y position (Bottom side of the image)
        Returns:
        Cropped image. Will return same passed bitmap if operation fails

      • cropImage

        public static android.graphics.Bitmap cropImage(@NonNull
                                                android.graphics.Bitmap imageToBeCropped,
                                                int startingXPos,
                                                int startingYPos,
                                                int endingXPos,
                                                int endingYPos,
                                                @Nullable
                                                java.lang.Float sidesBufferPercent)
        Crop an image to the positions passed. If any # <0 is passed or an error occurs, it will return the original bitmap passed
        Parameters:
        imageToBeCropped - Image to be cropped
        startingXPos - Starting X position (left side of the image)
        startingYPos - Starting Y position (Top side of the image)
        endingXPos - Ending X position (Right side of the image)
        endingYPos - Ending Y position (Bottom side of the image)
        sidesBufferPercent - Float percentage to allow buffer on sides for cropping. IE, sending in 0.10 would add a 10% buffer on each side to 'zoom out' on the cropped image. Useful if you want some extra side room
        Returns:
        Cropped image. Will return same passed bitmap if operation fails
